evidence: Clear module separation with 'methods' subpackage handling different platform-specific implementations (nat.py, pf.py, tproxy.py)
Well-defined internal APIs with explicit imports between modules (e.g., client.py imports from helpers.py, ssnet.py)
Centralized command-line interface in cmdline.py that orchestrates other modules
Separation of concerns with distinct modules for networking (ssnet.py), SSH (ssh.py), firewall (firewall.py), and helpers
Presence of a single setup.py with find_packages indicating a unified deployment unit
Test organization mirrors implementation structure with tests/ directory mapping to source modules
Average fan-out of ~4.9 suggests moderate coupling between well-defined modules rather than tight or loose coupling extremes
risks: Some modules like client.py and server.py are quite large and may become bottlenecks
High average fan-out could indicate some modules are doing too much coordination
Limited package count (only 2) suggests minimal horizontal decomposition
